item.title: 欧盟委员多姆布罗夫斯基斯表示，欧盟需要推出数字欧元以摆脱对美国的依赖。
item.description: 欧盟经济事务专员瓦尔迪斯·东布罗夫斯基斯周三表示，欧盟需要迅速创建数字欧元，以减少该集团对主导性美国支付公司的依赖。【原文：The European Union needs to quickly create a digital euro to cut the bloc's dependence on dominant U.S. payment companies, Economic Commissioner Valdis Dombrovskis said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 德国的默茨：美国不应质疑与欧盟的贸易协议
item.description: 德国总理弗里德里希·梅尔茨周三表示，只要华盛顿履行其承诺，欧盟与美国之间贸易协定的批准基础就已具备。【原文：The foundations for the ratification of a trade deal between the EU and U.S. are in place as long as Washington honours its commitments, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 经济学家称世界秩序已发生转变，但增长前景与一年前相同
item.description: 路透社对经济学家的季度调查显示，2026年全球经济增长率将达到3%，与一年前的预测完全一致。这表明经济学家们并未受到美国贸易政策突变及其对待盟友方式剧变的影响。【原文：Global economic growth will be 3% in 2026, exactly as forecast a year ago, according to a quarterly Reuters poll of economists, suggesting they are unfazed by the abrupt and seismic shift in how the U.S. trades with others and treats its allies.】

item.title: 贝森特称已有50万人注册"特朗普账户"，更多捐款正在涌入
item.description: 财政部长斯科特·贝森特周三表示，近日已有超过50万个家庭注册了特朗普政府的投资账户。此番表态是在一场活动前发表的，歌手妮琪·米娜将与总统唐纳德·特朗普共同出席该活动并发表演讲。【原文：More than 500,000 families ‌have signed up for the Trump administration's investment accounts in recent days, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Wednesday before an event at which singer Nicki Minaj will speak alongside President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 瑞银高级交易员称，为客户进行大规模美元对冲操作可能考验银行的承压能力
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS）一位高级交易员表示，投资者争相保护其美国资产免受美元贬值影响，这可能考验银行满足对冲需求的能力。瑞银是全球顶级货币交易商之一。【原文：Investors rushing to protect their U.S. assets against dollar ​depreciation could test banks' ability to meet demand for hedging, said ‌a senior trader at UBS , one of the world's top currency dealers.】

item.title: 美国上游并购市场第四季度反弹，交易额达235亿美元，Enverus称
item.description: 分析机构Enverus周三表示，美国上游并购市场在2025年下半年经历年中放缓后，于第四季度重拾增长势头，当季宣布交易额达235亿美元，推动全年并购总额攀升至650亿美元。【原文：The U.S. upstream mergers and acquisitions market regained momentum after a mid-year slowdown in the fourth quarter of 2025 reaching $23.5 ​billion in announced deals and pushing full-year activity to $65 billion, ‌analytics firm Enverus said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 谷歌将支付1.35亿美元以解决安卓数据传输诉讼案
item.description: 谷歌将支付1.35亿美元，以解决智能手机用户提起的集体诉讼。这些用户指控谷歌在未经许可的情况下，通过其安卓操作系统收集用户手机数据。【原文：Google will pay $135 million to settle a proposed class action by smartphone users who accused Google of programming its Android operating system to collect their cellular data without permission.】

item.title: 哈佛经济学家称美联储危机工具可能被武器化
item.description: 美国前国际货币基金组织首席经济学家肯尼思·罗格夫在被问及可能性时表示，美国央行在危机时期用于稳定全球金融市场的关键工具，可能被特朗普政府武器化。【原文：A key tool used by the U.S. central bank to stabilise global financial markets ​in times of crisis could be weaponised by the Trump administration, Kenneth Rogoff, a ‌former IMF chief economist said, when asked if that was a possibility.】

item.title: 加拿大央行维持利率不变，称难以预测未来动向
item.description: 加拿大央行周三如市场普遍预期般将政策利率维持在2.25%不变。行长蒂夫·麦克勒姆表示，当前高度不确定性使得预测下次利率调整的时间和方式变得困难。【原文：The Bank of Canada on Wednesday held its policy rate at 2.25%, as widely expected, and Governor Tiff Macklem said ​the high level of uncertainty made it difficult to predict when and how rates ‌might next change.】

item.title: 标普500指数首次突破7000点大关，人工智能乐观情绪助推
item.description: 标普500指数周三首次突破7000点大关，这主要得益于市场对人工智能的持续乐观预期、科技巨头强劲财报的预期以及货币政策宽松的推动。【原文：The S&P 500 breached the 7,000-point mark for the first time on Wednesday, driven by unrelenting optimism over artificial intelligence and ​expectations of strong Big Tech earnings as well as monetary policy easing.】

item.title: 消息人士称，巴西PicPay拟以最高定价区间进行纽约IPO
item.description: 知情人士透露，巴西数字银行PicPay预计将于周三在美国首次公开募股（IPO）定价，定价区间为每股16至19美元，最终定价将处于区间上限。【原文：Brazilian digital bank PicPay is expected to price its ​U.S. initial public offering (IPO) on ‌Wednesday at the top of the indicated price range of $16 to $19 per share, a source familiar with the ‌matter said.】

item.title: Tether首席执行官计划将公司投资组合中最多15%的资金配置于黄金
item.description: 加密货币集团Tether首席执行官保罗·阿尔多伊诺表示，该公司计划将其投资组合的10%至15%配置为实物黄金，这将补充其现有黄金储备——该公司称部分产品已由黄金提供支持。【原文：Tether plans to allocate 10%–15% of its investment portfolio to physical gold, the crypto group's CEO Paolo Ardoino said, adding to the bullion which it says already backs some of its products.】

item.title: 大众汽车瞄准亚洲和中东市场，寻求从中国出口的机遇
item.description: 大众汽车首席执行官兼中国区负责人表示，该公司计划利用在中国的低成本优势，增加从中国向其他市场出口汽车的数量——但不包括欧洲市场。【原文：Volkswagen plans to use its lower costs in China to export more cars from the country to other markets - but not Europe, the German carmaker's CEO and China chief said.】

item.title: 季度利润大幅攀升，首席财务官即将退休
item.description: 周三，进步保险公司报告称第四季度利润激增25%，主要得益于个人汽车保险业务的强劲需求。【原文：Progressive reported a 25% jump in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, driven by robust demand for personal auto insurance policies.】

item.title: 罗氏首席执行官表示，Wegovy口服药正在吸引新客户，包括男性群体。
item.description: 远程医疗公司Ro迎来大批新客户，他们寻求新推出的口服版Wegovy减肥药，其中包括那些对流行注射剂型望而却步的男性，Ro首席执行官扎克·雷塔诺表示。【原文：Telehealth company Ro has had an influx of new customers seeking the newly launched pill version of Wegovy to lose weight, including men who have shied away from taking the popular injection form, Ro CEO Zach Reitano said.】

item.title: Snap寻求投资，其新成立的智能眼镜部门将与Meta展开竞争
item.description: Snap将为其增强现实智能眼镜业务成立独立子公司，旨在吸引外部投资，并在快速增长的可穿戴设备市场中挑战其主要竞争对手Meta。【原文：Snap will create an independent subsidiary for its augmented reality smart glasses, as it looks to attract external investment and challenge bigger rival Meta in the fast-growing wearables market.】

item.title: Spotify称2025年向音乐产业支付了创纪录的110多亿美元
item.description: Spotify周三表示，去年向音乐产业支付了超过110亿美元，并称这是零售商向音乐产业支付的史上最高年度金额。【原文：Spotify said on Wednesday it had paid out more than $11 billion to the music industry last year, adding that it was the largest annual payment to music from a retailer in history.】

item.title: ADP上调年度营收预期，薪资服务需求强劲
item.description: 自动数据处理公司周三上调了年度营收预期，并超出季度利润预期，这得益于其薪酬和人力资源服务需求的持续稳定。【原文：Automatic Data Processing lifted its annual revenue forecast on Wednesday and surpassed quarterly profit estimates, helped by steady demand for its payroll and human resources services.】

item.title: 飞机制造商德事隆公布强劲季度业绩，2026年盈利预测低于预期
item.description: 德事隆周三公布的第四季度业绩实现增长，其核心航空业务板块受益于售后市场服务需求强劲及飞机交付量上升。【原文：Textron posted a rise in fourth-quarter results on Wednesday, as its mainstay aviation segment benefited from strong demand for aftermarket services and higher aircraft deliveries.】

item.title: MSCI第四季度利润因指数产品需求强劲而增长
item.description: 指数供应商MSCI周三报告称，第四季度利润实现增长，强劲的客户支出推动了对其指数产品和分析服务的需求。【原文：Index provider MSCI reported a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, as robust client spending boosted ​demand for its index products and analytics services.】

item.title: 瑞安航空预计在3至5年内随着技术进步将提供免费Wi-Fi服务
item.description: 瑞安航空首席执行官迈克尔·奥利里周三向路透社表示，随着技术进步，该公司预计将在三到五年内为整个机队提供免费Wi-Fi服务。此前他与埃隆·马斯克就使用其星链互联网服务一事公开争执。【原文：Ryanair expects to offer free Wi-Fi across its fleet within three-to-five years as the technology improves, CEO Michael O'Leary told Reuters on Wednesday, after a public spat with Elon Musk over the use of his Starlink internet service.】

item.title: 星巴克首季度全球同店销售额超预期，需求回暖
item.description: 星巴克周三公布的季度同店销售额增幅超出预期，这得益于美国市场需求在经历近两年低迷后出现反弹，也标志着首席执行官布莱恩·尼科尔的转型举措初见成效。【原文：Starbucks reported a bigger-than-expected rise in first-quarter comparable sales on Wednesday, as demand rebounded in the U.S. after ​nearly two years in early signs of success of CEO ‌Brian Niccol's turnaround efforts.】

item.title: 独家：NFL球星特拉维斯·凯尔斯入股床垫制造商Sleep Number
item.description: 美国国家橄榄球联盟球星特拉维斯·凯尔斯将入股Sleep Number公司。该公司表示，作为合作协议的一部分，凯尔斯将成为这家床垫制造商的最大股东之一，并担任品牌代言人，以吸引新客户。【原文：National Football League star Travis Kelce is taking a stake in Sleep Number as part of a partnership that will make him one of the mattress maker's top shareholders and a spokesman as it looks to attract new customers, the company said.】

item.title: 康宁公司预测第一季度销售额将超预期，因光纤需求强劲
item.description: 康宁公司周三预测第一季度销售额将超出预期，这得益于其光纤产品需求的强劲表现——该产品线贡献了公司近40%的营收。【原文：Corning on Wednesday forecast first-quarter sales above estimates, boosted by resilient demand for its fiber‑optic products, which generate nearly 40% of the company's revenue.】

item.title: 为提升效率，美国企业2026年持续裁员
item.description: 2026年伊始不到30天，美国各行业企业便纷纷宣布裁员计划，在人工智能工具应用日益普及的背景下，企业正通过削减成本和简化运营来应对挑战。【原文：Less than 30 days into 2026, U.S. companies across sectors have announced layoffs as they cut costs and simplify operations in the backdrop of rising adoption of artificial intelligence tools.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，美银将为员工的特朗普账户匹配1000美元政府补贴
item.description: 据路透社周三获得的一份内部备忘录显示，美国银行将为符合条件的员工匹配美国政府对拟议特朗普账户的1000美元初始捐款。【原文：Bank of America will match the U.S. ​government's initial $1,000 contribution to the proposed Trump Accounts for eligible ‌employees, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 通用动力公司第四季度营收因强劲的国防业务实现增长
item.description: 通用动力公司周三公布的财报显示，受作战系统和船舶系统业务增长推动，其第四季度营收实现增长。【原文：General Dynamics posted a rise in fourth-quarter revenue on Wednesday, driven by growth in its combat and marine systems segments.】

item.title: 新创企业PaleBlueDot在B Capital领投的融资轮中估值达10亿美元
item.description: 人工智能云初创企业PaleBlueDot AI向路透社透露，该公司已完成1.5亿美元B轮融资，估值突破10亿美元。随着其在美国和亚洲拓展人工智能计算服务，公司正加速业务扩张。【原文：Artificial intelligence cloud startup PaleBlueDot AI has raised $150 million in a Series B funding round, valuing the company at more than $1 billion as it expands AI computing offerings in the United States and Asia, the company told Reuters.】

item.title: 礼来公司与私营基因编辑公司Seamless达成最高11.2亿美元的协议
item.description: 美国制药巨头礼来公司周三宣布，已与德国初创企业Seamless Therapeutics达成协议，双方将合作开发并商业化听力损失治疗方案，该协议价值最高可达11.2亿美元。该合作将基于Seamless Therapeutics的基因编辑平台展开。【原文：U.S. drugmaker Eli Lilly signed an agreement worth up to $1.12 billion with Seamless Therapeutics, the Germany-based startup said on Wednesday, to develop and commercialize treatments for hearing loss using the biotech's gene-editing platform.】

item.title: 晨间竞标：让疲软美元重现辉煌
item.description: 当今美国及全球市场中真正重要的因素【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】
